page.description: Opens the Define Arguments Dialog that lets you define arguments.

section.description: An argument is a value that is interpreted at run-time. Arguments can be used with SQL, DBF, and Custom data source types. This feature can be very useful in filtering data to generate reports and lists of filtered data. For more on this, watch these videos on [Understanding Array Arguments in Report Filters] and [Using Array Arguments with List Controls]. In addition see the [Arguments] section of the documentation.
You can also designate that an argument is an array by pre-fixing the argument with an 'array_'.

sections.title: Define Arguments Dialog
sections.description: You can open this dialog by clicking on the 'Arguments' option in the Additional Options Menu on the UX Controls page toolbar.

section.description: You can also open this dialog from inside the Data Source pane in the list control's List Builder when the 'SQL', 'DBF', or 'Custom' options are selected.
